Strings.String: Active mode is detected at this hub.
Address for updates is blank or invalid.

ADLSearch is a tool for fast searching of directory listings downloaded from users. Create a new ADLSearch entering 'avi' as search string for example. When you download a directory listing from a user, all AVI-files will be placed in a special folder called <<<ADLSearch>>> for easy finding. It is almost the same as using the standard 'Find' multiple times in a directory listing.
Special options: - 'Active' check box selects if the search is used or not. - 'Source Type' can be the following options; 'Filename' matches search against filename, 'Directory' matches against current subdirectory and places the whole structure in the special folder, 'Full Path' matches against whole directory + filename. - 'Destination Directory' selects the special output folder for a search. Multiple folders with different names can exist simultaneously. - 'Min/Max Size' sets file size limits. This is not used for 'Directory' type searches. - 'Move Up'/'Move Down' can be used to organize the list of searches.
There is a new option in the context menu (right-click) for directory listings. It is called 'Go to directory' and can be used to jump to the original location of the file or directory.
Extra features:
1) If you use %y.%m.%d in a search string it will be replaced by today's date. Switch place on y/m/d, or leave any of them out to alter the substitution. If you use %[nick] it will be replaced by the nick of the user you download the directory listing from.
2) If you name a destination directory 'discard', it will not be shown in the total result. Useful with the extra feature 3) below to remove uninteresting results.
3) There is a switch called 'Break on first ADLSearch match' in Settings->Advanced'. If enabled, ADLSearch will stop after the first match for a specific file/directory. The order in the ADLSearch windows is therefore important. Example: Add a search item at the top of the list with string='xxx' and destination='discard'. It will catch many pornographic files and they will not be included in any following search results.

Command Types: Separator: Adds a separator to the menu Raw: Sends raw command to the hub (experts only, end it with '|'!) Chat: Sends command as if you were typing it in the chat PM: Sends command as if you sent it by PM Contexts determine where the command is shown: Hub Menu: Hub tab (at the bottom of the screen) right-click menu Chat Menu: User right-click menu in chat and PM tab menu Search Menu: Search right-click menu Parameters: Name: Name (use '' to create submenus) Command: Command text (may contain parameters) Hub: Hub IP as typed when connecting (empty = all hubs, "op" = hubs where you're op) To: PM recipient Only once: Send only once per user from search frame In the parameters, you can use %[xxx] variables and date/time specifiers (%Y, %m, …). The following are available: %[myNI]: your own nick %[userNI]: the user's nick (user && search context only) %[userTAG]: user tag (user && search context only) %[userDE]: user description (user && search con4text only) %[userEM]: user email (user && search context only) %[userSS]: user shared bytes (exact) (user && search context only) %[userSSshort]: user shared bytes (formatted) (user && search context only) %[userI4]: user IP (if supported by hub) %[fileFN]: filename (search context only) %[line:reason]: opens up a window asking for "reason"

/itunes - For iTunes media spamming - %[version] - version (ex: 10.0.1.22) - %[album] - name of the album the current track is from - %[artist] - artist of the current track - %[title] - name of the currently playing track - %[genre] - genre of the currently playing track - %[elapsed] - time elapsed in minutes:seconds - %[percent] - time elapsed presented as percentage from total length - %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) - %[length] - total length of the current track - %[bitrate] - bitrate for the playing track (kbps) - %[frequency] - frequency for the currently playing track (kHz) - %[year] - year of publication/recording of the current track - %[size] - size of the currently playing file - %[state] - current state of iTunes (playing/stopped)
Empty = Default String -> +me listens %[artist] - %[title] • listened to %[percent] (%[length], %[bitrate], iTunes %[version])
You have no media playing in iTunes

- %[filepath] - name of the file currently playing - %[title] - name of the currently playing item (without file extension) - %[artist] - artist - %[state] - current state of JetAudio (playing/paused/stopped) - %[elapsed] - time elapsed in minutes:seconds - %[percent] - time elapsed presented as percentage from total length - %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) - %[length] - total length of the current file - %[version] - Version on JetAudio - %[magnet] - magnet to current file (if not shared - show only filename )
Empty = Default String -> +me listens %[artist] - %[title] * listened to %[percent], JetAudio %[version]

The requested address is not valid in its context.
A socket operation encountered a dead network.
A socket operation was attempted to an unreachable network.
The connection has been broken due to keep-alive activity detecting a failure while the operation was in progress.
An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine.
An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.
An operation on a socket could not be performed because the system lacked sufficient buffer space or because a queue was full.
A connect request was made on an already connected socket.
A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond.
No connection could be made because the target machine actively refused it.
Name component or name was too long.
A socket operation failed because the destination host was down.
Socks server authentication failed (bad login / password?)
The socks server doesn't support login / password authentication
The socks server failed establish a connection
Failed to set up the socks server for UDP relay (check socks address and port)

- %a - Abbreviated weekday name - %A - Full weekday name - %b - Abbreviated month name - %B - Full month name - %c - Date and time representation appropriate for locale - %d - Day of month as decimal number (01 – 31) - %H - Hour in 24-hour format (00 – 23) - %I - Hour in 12-hour format (01 – 12) - %j - Day of year as decimal number (001 – 366) - %m - Month as decimal number (01 – 12) - %M - Minute as decimal number (00 – 59) - %p - Current locale's A.M./P.M. indicator for 12-hour clock - %S - Second as decimal number (00 – 59) - %U - Week of year as decimal number, with Sunday as first day of week (00 – 53) - %w - Weekday as decimal number (0 – 6; Sunday is 0) - %W - Week of year as decimal number, with Monday as first day of week (00 – 53) - %x - Date representation for current locale - %X - Time representation for current locale - %y - Year without century, as decimal number (00 – 99) - %Y - Year with century, as decimal number - %z, %Z - Either the time-zone name or time zone abbreviation, depending on registry settings; no characters if time zone is unknown - %% - Percent sign
Default: %H:%M:%S

/winamp - Works with Winamp 1.x, 2.x, 5.x (no Winamp 3 support)
- %[version] - version (ex: 5.58) - %[state] - playing state (ex: stopped/paused/playing) - %[title] - window title from Winamp. If you want to change this for mp3s, Winamp > Pref > Input > MPEG > Title - %[rawtitle] - window title from Winamp (if %[title] not working properly) - %[percent] - percentage (ex. 40%) - %[length] - length (ex: 09:00) - %[elapsed] - time elapsed (ex. 07:51) - %[bar] - ASCII progress bar, 10 characters wide no including brackets (ex. [----|-----]) - %[bitrate] - bitrate (ex. 707kbps) - %[sample] - sample frequency (ex. 44kHz) - %[channels] - number of channels (ex. stereo / mono)
- %[magnet] - magnet to current file (if not shared - show only filename )
Empty = Default String: +me listen: %[artist] - %[elapsed] %[track] - %[title] • listened to %[percent] (%[length], %[bitrate], Winamp %[version])
Note about The KMPlayer: You can use most of the features offered by /winamp command and all features of the media toolbar also with The KMPlayer. Parameters that are known not to work (or return incorrect values) are %[version], %[bitrate], %[sample] and %[channels]. It's also very likely that you will need to use %[rawtitle] instead of %[title] to get the correct output.
